meanings.definition: To have sexual intercourse with someone.
meanings.sent1: Tom rogered his girlfriend last night.
meanings.sent2: Sheila and Mark rogered in the bedroom.
meanings.sent3: The birds and the bees rogered in the garden.
meanings.sent4: The train rogered through the tunnel with great speed.
meanings.sent5: The storm rogered the coastline, leaving destruction in its wake.

meanings.sent1: John felt rogered when he realized he had been tricked.
meanings.sent2: The con artist rogered many unsuspecting victims.
meanings.sent3: The magician rogered the audience with his sleight of hand.
meanings.sent4: The mirage rogered the weary travelers in the desert.
meanings.sent5: The faulty compass rogered the hikers, leading them astray.

meanings.definition: To be treated roughly or unfairly.
meanings.sent1: The workers felt rogered by their demanding boss.
meanings.sent2: The prisoner was rogered by the harsh prison conditions.
meanings.sent3: The old car felt rogered after the bumpy ride.
meanings.sent4: The worn-out shoes were rogered by the rough terrain.
meanings.sent5: The fragile vase was rogered during shipping, arriving in pieces.
